name: World Business Chicago
html_description: World Business Chicago (WBC) leads Chicago’s business retention, attraction and expansion efforts and raises the city’s position as a premier global business destination. A not-for-profit economic development organization chaired by Mayor Rahm Emanuel and directed by Rita R. Athas, WBC fosters private sector growth and jobs through the advancement of a business-friendly environment that attracts world class talent. WBC advances Chicago’s position as a thriving location for business and enhances economic growth in the best city in the world in which to live, work, and play. WBC’s staff navigates the site selection process for businesses by providing economic and industry data, site location assistance, state and local incentive information, and bringing together key parties to spur and accelerate economic growth.

name: Tribeca Flashpoint Media Arts Academy
html_description: Tribeca Flashpoint Academy is one of the industry’s most well-known and respected media arts schools—providing intensive, direct-to-industry associate degree programs that propel graduates into “the business” in a way few other institutions can. A venture with Robert De Niro’s Tribeca Enterprises, Tribeca Flashpoint Academy offers a progressive training model that erases the boundaries between education and the professional world by exposing students to real-world, industry experiences and state-of-the-art software and equipment beginning their first semester on campus. Part college, part industry apprenticeship, TFA equips graduates with the up-to-the minute technical skills, robust resume of real-world experiences, and powerful industry know-how they need to launch their careers in the digital media arts.

name: Technology Transfer Office
html_description: Northern Illinois University recognizes that University-Industry research collaboration has contributed significantly to national competitiveness, to the intellectual vitality of universities, and to the economic health of industry. The University's Technology Transfer Office (TTO) was created to encourage and nurture the development, disclosure, protection and commercialization of university intellectual property as well as to promote and market university intellectual property to industry and increase awareness of university research capabilities. As part of its mission, the TTO also participates in the University's role in facilitating the economic development and prosperity of the northern Illinois region.

name: Polsky Center Accelerator Program
address: Polsky Center for Entrepreneurship at The U of C Booth School of Business
html_description: Launched in June 2012, the Polsky Center Accelerator Program gives student teams the opportunity to work on their businesses and social enterprises in a collaborative and dynamic environment. The Accelerator Program accepts 10 teams to participate through a competitive selection process. These teams receive funding, office space, access to Polsky Center staff, coaching from faculty, mentorship from alumni entrepreneurs and Chicago-area investors, and weekly programming designed to help them overcome many of the hurdles to launching a business. By talking with consumers, investors, and mentors, building prototypes, and continually refining their business models, these start-ups make notable progress over the 10 weeks of the program and in many cases move from business plan to launch.
institution_name: University of Chicago Booth School of Business

name: Built In Chicago Startup Launch
html_description:
Built In Chicago Startup Launch events give recently launched startups the opportunity to present their companies in front of 350 investors, fellow entrepreneurs, and startup enthusiasts.

This is quickly becoming a "must" attend for local investors (I2A Fund, New World Ventures, FireStarter Fund, Hyde Park Angels and more attend!) and entrepreneurs alike.  Are you looking to fund a startup? Receive funding for your startup? Hire talent? Meet a co-founder? Network? This is the event in Chicago you must attend.

name: Valor Equity Partners
html_description: Valor Equity Partners is an operationally active private equity firm focused on making expansion, growth and buyout investments. We partner with talented management teams, providing the active operational support necessary to accelerate growth and improvement within their companies. Valor Equity Partners focuses on investments in growth companies that have excellent management teams who value a collaborative approach to building great businesses.

name: Breakout Labs
html_description: Breakout Labs is the Thiel Foundation’s newest program. Through Breakout Labs, we’re reshaping the way early-stage science is funded, so that early-stage companies can advance their most radical ideas. Venture capital firms want research that can be quickly brought to market, and federal funding offers little room for risky, unproven ideas. We are jumping into this funding gap to energize innovative research. Breakout Labs is not a typical foundation grant—we are a revolutionary, revolving funding model where successful projects fund the next generation of audacious scientific exploration.

name: Monthly Business Education Workshop
html_description: The Department of Business Affairs & Consumer Protection (BACP) offers workshops every Wednesday and Friday. Workshops vary each month and are conducted by City Officials, experts and partner business organizations. All workshops are free, and open to the public. Workshops are held at BACP's offices located at 121 N. LaSalle St., City Hall Room 805, Chicago, IL 60602.
additional_institutions: Department of Business Affairs & Consumer Protection

name: Business Start-Up Certificate Program
html_description:
The Department of Business Affairs & Consumer Protection (BACP) offers a program designed to give business owners the essential elements in starting and growing a business. In order to participate, business owners attend nine workshops at BACP and earn a Business Start-Up Certificate. Participants learn the essentials in business planning, financing, marketing, legal issues, technology and more.

Program overview:

  • Participation is free and optional.
  • Complete the program workshops within six months and walk away with a certificate.
  • Earn your certificate and get free expert advice on your business plan.
  • Register for the Business Start-Up Certificate Program at any BACP workshop.
additional_institutions: Department of Business Affairs & Consumer Protection

name: Rocket Fuel Labs
html_description: Fueling Ideas, Launching Companies. We invest in great ideas and teams to build products that transform how people and businesses interact. We roll-up our sleeves and work directly with entrepreneurs to design, build, fund, grow, launch, manage & support their companies. We understand that, beyond a great idea and excellent product development, entrepreneurs need much more to launch real companies. We offer an array of complementary services that will substantially increase your chances of success.

name: Business Innovation Services
html_description: Helping thousands of organizations for 28 years, the group at U of I Business Innovation Services (BIS) provides customized training services and technical assistance, as well as public workshops and certificate programs. With a professional staff of experts, we specialize in organization-wide systemic improvement from top management strategy to hourly worker skills. Our most effective role is to help develop the potential within each organization to achieve a culture where innovation and constant improvement thrive. Our hallmark has been our ability to help organizations change and grow profitably. We do this through collaboration with the talent within the organization, introducing new methodologies and systems to drive innovation and ideas that create the future. U of I - BIS has a powerful track record of success helping to build high-performing organizations in manufacturing, healthcare, municipalities, and financial services. Our goal is to promote a robust U.S. economy helping organizations compete globally and profitably. BIS provides expertise in strategic global leadership, innovation strategy, six sigma, lean operations, quality system implementation, customer and employee surveys, IT certification, software training, essential and technical skills, continuous process improvement, HR, executive leadership and culture change.

name: Cibola
html_description: It's hard out there to build a company on your own. We are building a space to support the faces and voices of entrepreneurship that we need to see more of. Cibola has the vibe of a funky nightclub, the technology of a wired office, the resources of the best private schools, and the members attitude of a lodge. We are dedicated to building companies of all kinds, with a focus on tech entrepreneurship, social enterprise, and growing both Pilsen and Chicago's entrepreneur communities.

name: Ocean Tomo, LLC
html_description:
Established in 2003, Ocean Tomo, LLC, is the Intellectual Capital Merchant Banc™ firm providing an industry leading array of financial products and services related to intangible assets. Ocean Tomo offerings include expert testimony, valuation, strategy, research, ratings, investments, risk management and transactions. Ocean Tomo assists clients – corporations, law firms, governments and institutional investors – in realizing Intellectual Capital Equity® value broadly defined.

Ocean Tomo's culture is entrepreneurial, open and based on a foundation of common sense. Most importantly, Ocean Tomo is an organization built on the concept of the "team" where every employee makes a difference. Our culture is a key differentiator when recruiting new professionals and can be seen in our actions, policies and values.
sectors_facet: Clean Tech/Alternative Energy, Food/Agriculture, IT/Digital/Web-Mobile, Manufacturing, Biotech and Life Sciences, Healthcare and Medical Devices, Nanotechnology, Transportation/Logistics, Social/Impact Venture, Telecommunications

name: Pumping Station One
html_description: Pumping Station One is a hackerspace located in Chicago. Its mission is to foster a collaborative environment wherein people can explore and create intersections between technology, science, art, and culture. We also fulfill our role as a community resource by hosting classes on electronics, programming, crafts, and any other skills that members (or guests) are willing to share.
sectors_facet: Clean Tech/Alternative Energy, IT/Digital/Web-Mobile, Manufacturing, Biotech and Life Sciences, Nanotechnology, Telecommunications

name: StartupStay
html_description: StartupStay.com is a global community for entrepreneurs that travel. Entrepreneurs in start-ups or with a startup idea can build meaningful business connections with entrepreneurs worldwide; gain access to local insights; and increase productivity and eliminate accommodation costs by staying with a local host entrepreneur in the destination city. Our community relies on the generosity of local entrepreneurs who host visiting entrepreneurs. Guests return that generosity by exchanging business knowledge and tips, sharing their skills or even tapping into their business network. We envision the creation of new friendships, partnerships, business opportunities, and even new companies as a result of entrepreneurs meeting through StartupStay.
sectors_facet: Clean Tech/Alternative Energy, Food/Agriculture, IT/Digital/Web-Mobile, Manufacturing, Biotech and Life Sciences, Healthcare and Medical Devices, Nanotechnology, Transportation/Logistics, Social/Impact Venture, Telecommunications

name: Wavetable Labs
html_description: Wavetable Labs builds entrepreneurial teams to identify, validate and scale digital businesses. We recruit Founders-in-Residence, help them identify promising ideas, recruit teams and provide them with capital to get the business off the ground. Founding teams gain access to our network, collaboration with our experienced team, training in our proven process and access to capital, both from us and from our network of investors.
sectors_facet: IT/Digital/Web-Mobile

name: Chancellor's Innovation Fund
html_description: The University of Illinois at Chicago is launching a $10 million fund to help inventions advance from the research stage toward potential commercial opportunities, becoming the latest academic institution in the area to channel increased resources toward homegrown startup activity. The Chancellor's Innovation Fund will allocate $2 million a year for five years. Each year, $1 million will go toward proof-of-concept funding and the other $1 million will be used for equity seed investments in companies that are further along in the commercialization process.
sectors_facet: Clean Tech/Alternative Energy, Food/Agriculture, IT/Digital/Web-Mobile, Manufacturing, Biotech and Life Sciences, Healthcare and Medical Devices, Nanotechnology, Transportation/Logistics, Social/Impact Venture, Telecommunications

name: The 3D Printer Experience
html_description:
You may have read about it in the media or heard about it in the President's State of the Union address, but now you’ll have the opportunity to see what the buzz is all about.
With over twenty 3D printers in-house and exciting new applications for you to play with, we’re here to introduce you to a very bright future of personal, desktop manufacturing. We are dedicated to helping you down a new path of greater creativity and freedom.
This technology will dramatically alter our lives in the coming years so come visit and take part in a more imaginative and promising world.
sectors_facet: Manufacturing

name: BizSpark
html_description: The BizSpark program provides technology, support, visibility, and community to promising startups and entrepreneurs at no charge. In order to qualify for BizSpark, a startup must be a privately held software development company that makes less than US $1M annually and is less than five years old. The program currently serve 50,000+ members in 100 countries across 6 continents.
nonprofit_facet: Networking Opportunities, Web-based or Meetup Group
sectors_facet: IT/Digital/Web-Mobile

name: Licensing Executives Society - Chicago Chapter
html_description: For nearly 50 years, the Licensing Executives Society has been the leading association for intellectual property, technology, and business development professionals to achieve professional and personal success. Whether you are new to licensing or an experienced licensing executive, LES is your professional home. The Chicago Chapter is one of over 35 LES Chapters in LES (USA & Canada.) LES Chapters are located throughout USA and Canada in areas with concentrations of LES Members and licensing professionals. The Chicago Chapter, under the direction of the Chapter Leadership hold regular meetings where LES Members and outside speakers give presentations on topics relevant to technology transfer and licensing.
sectors_facet: Clean Tech/Alternative Energy, Food/Agriculture, IT/Digital/Web-Mobile, Manufacturing, Biotech and Life Sciences, Healthcare and Medical Devices, Nanotechnology, Transportation/Logistics, Social/Impact Venture, Telecommunications

name: Center for Applied Innovation
html_description: The Center for Applied Innovation is an Illinois non-profit corporation created to manage education, public policy outreach and related economic activity around applied technology and intellectual property (IP) rights in the State of Illinois and around the world. Applied technology is defined as proven IP or technology that is in use or was developed for a specific purpose and protected by patents and/or patent applications (as well as other forms of intellectual property such as trademarks and copyrights). The Center will examine the current environment and identify opportunities for IP to be utilized both in the State of Illinois and across the world to stimulate economic growth. The Center will create a critical mass of available resources and focus on redeploying existing IP, but will also encourage continued technology development.
sectors_facet: Clean Tech/Alternative Energy, Food/Agriculture, IT/Digital/Web-Mobile, Manufacturing, Biotech and Life Sciences, Healthcare and Medical Devices, Nanotechnology, Transportation/Logistics, Social/Impact Venture, Telecommunications

name: Maddock Douglas
html_description:
We exist to help our clients bring industry-changing products, services and business models from mind to market. A typical engagement has three key steps:

1. Finding the need and developing clear insights. It involves doing all the “homework” required to identify the most significant economic areas of opportunity.

2. Generating and testing ideas to meet those needs. This results in a robust pipeline of new products, services and/or business models that are tested, prioritized and then serve as the cornerstone for a recommended strategy.

3. Monetizing the chosen ideas. This means effectively leveraging the new innovation assets internally across the enterprise, and by bringing the concepts to market in order to generate substantial new revenues and profits.

These three steps are designed to drive ideas from mind to market. We also integrate culture of innovation leadership practices, mindset shifts, structural transformation, tools and training to address the corporate inertia (often ignored “dark space”) that consistently inhibits innovation success. This essential element is incorporated prior to, during and after engagements to make sure that the company knows how to move the best ideas forward.
sectors_facet: Clean Tech/Alternative Energy, Food/Agriculture, IT/Digital/Web-Mobile, Manufacturing, Biotech and Life Sciences, Healthcare and Medical Devices, Nanotechnology, Transportation/Logistics, Social/Impact Venture, Telecommunications

name: Ringleader Ventures
html_description: Accelerating ideas from Mind-to-Market, Ringleader Ventures moves exceptional ideas through years of entrepreneurial challenges and learning in just a few short months, transforming them into world-changing companies. We exist to inspire and empower curiosity. RLV creates a predictable, powerful way to scale this purpose.
sectors_facet: Clean Tech/Alternative Energy, Food/Agriculture, IT/Digital/Web-Mobile, Manufacturing, Biotech and Life Sciences, Healthcare and Medical Devices, Nanotechnology, Transportation/Logistics, Social/Impact Venture, Telecommunications

name: InSPIRE Illinois
html_description: The Institute for Solar Photovoltaic Innovation, Research, and Edu-training ("InSPIRE" or "InSPIRE Illinois") is a nonprofit organization whose mission is to promote research, development, workforce training, and technology commercialization within the solar and renewable energy industry. InSPIRE’s vision is to create a solar and renewable energy industry in Illinois where scientists and inventors create and commercialize cutting-edge technology, and companies manufacture the systems and modules that incorporate this technology for export around the world.
nonprofit_facet: Industry Association, Mentorship, Networking Opportunities, Web-based or Meetup Group
other_facet: Public Events, Educational & Training Programs, Competitions, Mentorship Programs
sectors_facet: Clean Tech/Alternative Energy, Social/Impact Venture

name: StartupDigest
html_description:
StartupDigest is the free weekly email to help you meet people and learn more in the tech startup world. Chris McCann and his co-founder Brendan McManus created StartupDigest with the belief that life is too short to work at a boring company and it should be easy for anyone to join the tech startup world. StartupDigest now publishes hundreds of newsletters that help thousands of people just like you get more involved in startup communities across hundreds of cities all over the world.

Every week we’ll send you the best tech startup events in your local community and a reading list of the best articles from around the startup world. Everything we feature is chosen by curators who are active founders, hackers, designers, or investors.
nonprofit_facet: Industry Association, Networking Opportunities, Web-based or Meetup Group
sectors_facet: IT/Digital/Web-Mobile

name: Technori Pitch
html_description: Designed to be a showcase of launching startups, Technori Pitch gathers 550 people together in Chicago, every single month, to watch as five startups launch on-stage. With a production quality that far exceeds comparable events, Pitch is designed to elevate the startup showcase to a level on-par with theater experience.
sectors_facet: IT/Digital/Web-Mobile

name: ChicagoHour
html_description: ChicagoHour connects the up and comers of Chicago and beyond.
nonprofit_facet: Networking Opportunities, Web-based or Meetup Group
sectors_facet: IT/Digital/Web-Mobile

name: Illinois MakerLab
html_description:
The Illinois MakerLab opened in Spring 2013 as the first makerspace based in a business school.The objective of this lab is to provide a unique and valuable resource for students and faculty to gain hands-on experiential learning with 3D Modeling and Printing, a technology gaining adoption at the consumer level. We encourage interdisciplinary projects in the lab, and the space will be a resource for faculty interested in conducting research about 3D printing in specific, and the growth of customer-empowered creation in general.

We have six MakerBot Replicator2 3D printers, along with some workspace for students to collaborate while working on their projects. We also have a Raspberry Pi in the Lab. The lab is located in Room 103, Surveying Building on the UofI Campus.
sectors_facet: IT/Digital/Web-Mobile, Manufacturing

name: National Center for Food Safety and Technology
resource_name: National Center for Food Safety and Technology
html_description:
Founded in 1988, the National Center for Food Safety and Technology (NCFST) is a unique research consortium among the US Food and Drug Administrationäó»s Center for Food Safety and Applied Nutrition (FDA CFSAN), Illinois Institute of Technology (IIT) and the food industry.æUnder the cooperative agreement, NCFST was established by IIT to bring together the food safety and technology expertise of academia, industry and FDA with the common goal of enhancing and improving the safety of food for US consumers.
Under the newly formed Institute for Food Safety and Health, NCFSTæwill continue to provide a one-of-a-kind neutral ground where industry, academia and government scientists pool their expertise and institutional perspectives to drive food science and technology forward to assure safe and healthy foods for consumers. For more than two decades, this successful collaborative research model has served as a forum for industry to interact with FDA to address critical food processing issues, providing the foundation for scientifically sound, sensible regulations leading to safer food products, and supplying food companies and technology developers with authoritative science-based information to enhance the safety of their production systems and finished products.

name: Center for Nutrition Research
html_description:
The promise of health promoting foods to improve nutrition and to reduce the onset of vascular disease, obesity, diabetes, and other major chronic illnesses linked to poor diet quality has consumers flocking to their local supermarkets in search of products that will help them to lead longer, healthier lives. At the same time, rising healthcare costs are leading governments to institute preventive health initiatives involving food.

The IFSH Center for Nutrition Research connects industry with ways to determine the health promoting properties of food components, align nutrition objectives with food safety requirements, and evaluate the impact of food processing and packaging technologies on nutritional values to ensure delivery of the highest quality products to consumers. The Center supports the work of the Clinical Nutrition Research Center (CNRC), which conducts human nutrition and clinical research to determine the health benefits of foods and food components in a variety of study areas, and assists industry with assessing and determining science-based health claims, which must be developed, commercialized and regulated in a safe and effective manner.

name: Center for Processing Innovation
html_description: The IFSH Center for Processing Innovation is a highly credible source for industry companies of all sizes seeking applied scientific information that can serve as a basis for developing and implementing requirements of the Food Safety Modernization Act (FSMA). With state-of-the-art research facilities, including a fully operational pilot plant with a GMP processing and kitchen area, a BSL-2 food processing laboratory suite, and a BSL-3 laboratory and biocontainment pilot plant, the IFSH CPI has strong capabilities for confirming and validating the efficacy of risk-based preventive control measures using pathogenic organisms in near real-world processing environments, referenced on numerous occasions in the FSMA.

name: IFSH Center for Specialty Programs
html_description:
The proficiency testing program at the Institute for Food Safety and Health (IFSH) produces proficiency testing (PT) samples for both FDA and USDA food safety programs. The center also manages the food chemistry and microbiology proficiency testing programs for the Food Emergency Response Network (FERN). Laboratory performance is tested by challenging analysts with simulated samples to test within their normal operating conditions in order to produce an interlaboratory comparison.

IFSH expects to make proficiency testing services available to food industry members in the future. As the PT program expands, the laboratory will enter the process of ISO 17043 certification and expects to offer additional analytical capabilities, such as freeze dried proficiency testing samples.

name: Duman Entrepreneurship Center North Side Small Business Development Center
resource_name: Duman Entrepreneurship Center Small Business Development Center
html_description: We know that by helping small businesses launch, expand and improve their profitability, we’re also helping them create jobs in the Chicago area. And that helps everyone. That’s why we offer support and educational training programs for all entrepreneurs, including veterans, ex-offenders and even home-based businesses. Our clients are adults in the Chicago area who are starting up a new business or expanding their existing one. We specialize in making low cost business loans to eligible small businesses in the Chicago area that cannot access loan funds through traditional lending channels. We provide one-on-one business advice at no charge for existing and start-up small businesses. We offer entrepreneurial training, business assistance, mentoring and access to capital.
meta_keywords: SBDC, DCEO, ILDCEO, Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity

name: Entrepreneurs-in-Residence
html_description: The Research Park created an Entrepreneur-in-Residence (EIR) program that hires local experienced technology entrepreneurs to provide monthly consulting to new startup ventures and prospective technology entrepreneurs. By sourcing this talent from the local region, the program selects peers that have faced similar challenges in commercializing research/early stage technology and are able to provide advice on their own path to successfully attracting investment, revenue, and industrial clients. The EIRs provide weekly office hours for availability for any Research Park client or University of Illinois faculty, staff, or student entrepreneur to receive business consulting, strategy assistance, marketing and communication help, investor preparedness, or other startup consultation needed. The EIR program also has monthly training events for technology entrepreneurs based on topics identified in client counseling as areas of need and to cover basic fundamentals most entrepreneurs face such as: intellectual property basics, business development and sales, SBIR/STTR grant writing, and investor options and negotiations.

name: Illinois Venture Capital Association
html_description:
The Illinois Venture Capital Association (IVCA) advocates for a strong venture capital and private equity industry in Illinois by:

  • promoting pro-growth public policy initiatives,
  • providing educational programming in private equity,
  • facilitating member networking, and
  • endorsing communication and shared programs with organizations of mutual interest.

In addition, IVCA works with entrepreneurial organizations in the Midwest to encourage a strong cycle of innovation and business creation leading to superior investment opportunities.

name: Deaf Communication
html_description:
DCI is a Chicago-based, Deaf owned and operated business created to improve communication between Deaf and hearing people through advanced technology and interpreting services. Highly regarded by clients for quality and customer service, we pride ourselves on maintaining a personal relationship with customers, interpreters and the Deaf individuals we serve.

We provide a wide range of interpreting and captioning services, as well as ASL instruction and multimedia services.

name: Glines Associates
html_description:
Retained executive search firm devoted to acquiring the best talent for the Medical Device and Life Sciences industry.

Devoted to serving the Medical Device and Life Sciences industry for over twenty five years, we provide solutions to our clients' talent needs. Larry Glines, who has been engaged in executive search and selection, solely for the Healthcare and Life Sciences industry, since 1984, established the firm in 1994.

INDUSTRY EXPERTISE
As experts with over twenty five years devoted to recruiting in the Healthcare & Life Sciences industry, we have the knowledge and experience to develop and execute strategies that reach, attract and win the best talent.

PRECISION SEARCH & RECRUITMENT
Our industry experience and market specialization combined with our knowledgeable networking and comprehensive internet based research tools provides the expertise needed to yield a select slate of highly qualified candidates. This results in your search having a quick launch and a timely closure.

HANDS ON INVOLVEMENT
The consultant you hire actually does the majority of the work and is assisted by our professional research and support staff. Accountability is firmly established so you can always be certain about the quality of our services.

RESULTS & SATISFACTION
We team with you to find talented people who can make an impact on your organization. Over 80% of our work is repeat business. We complete 100% of our assignments. No matter what difficulties we encounter we will not stop until you are completely satisfied.

name: R&D STEM Learning Exchange
contact_name: Erin Lane, Director of STEM Initiatives
html_description: The Research and Development (R&D) STEM Learning Exchange is a public-private partnership in Illinois, designed to expand inquiry-based and hands-on learning experiences for students related to research and development, as well as science, engineering, technology and math. Piloting in fifteen high schools in the 2013-2014 school year, the Learning Exchange is focused on implementing three key initiatives: STEM challenges, electronic mentor matching, and creating a virtual repository of standards-aligned learning content. Through the public-private approach of the Learning Exchange, companies are able to address talent pipeline needs in critical industry sectors, students will gain access to new tools and programs, and the statewide community around STEM education is strengthened to continue developing the next generation of innovators.

name: ColorJar
html_description: ColorJar is a digital agency that specializes in positioning strategy and creating custom websites and apps.

name: UBS Wealth Management
html_description:
Advice. Beyond investing.

UBS offers financial planning and asset protection planning for start-ups.

Today, trusted financial advice is more important than ever. As your Financial Advisor, I take my responsibility to provide that advice very seriously. That's why a comprehensive planning approach informs all of our conversations. It helps me learn all I can about you so we can address your most important priorities. What's more, if your circumstances change over time, or new opportunities arise, I can adjust your plan to ensure it's on track.

Whether you're looking to build wealth for the future, protect it for the next generation or creating a giving strategy for the people and causes that mean so much, we are well positioned with straightforward advice and a solid plan that will give you greater confidence to pursue all of your life goals—no matter what the environment.

name: Global College Search Associates, LLC
html_description:
We help national and international students and their families navigate the complex terrain of college prep and college search. Whether you are looking into undergraduate or graduate programs, we can help you get prepared for the journey ahead. We work either one-on-one, through high schools, in tandem with financial consultants and in corporate human resource offices.

We have helped hundreds of college-bound students and families find clarity in confusion, direction in chaos, and success despite challenges both unique and common.

name: Oak Park Development Corporation
html_description:
Established in 1974 by area banks and businesses, the Oak Park Development Corporation (OPDC) is one of the Chicago area’s most successful community economic redevelopment agencies.

OPDC acts as a catalyst between developers, property and business owners, and Village staff and officials. Our organization’s primary functions include:

  • Developing and administering financial incentives to attract and support businesses.
  • Helping companies find commercial locations through our database of available properties.
  • Encouraging new or expanded business development and tourism.
  • Working to broaden Oak Park’s tax base and increase tax revenue.

OPDC is a private, not-for-profit corporation

name: Microsoft Technology Center Chicago
html_description: MICROSOFT TECHNOLOGY CENTERS (MTCs) are collaborative environments that provide access to innovative technologies and world-class expertise, enabling Microsoft customers to envision, design, and deploy solutions to meet their exact needs.

name: 7wire Ventures
html_description:
The biggest problems need solving - and 7wire looks for, and invests in, innovative ideas and entrepreneurs that address three critical areas: health care, education, and energy. Through the creation of new businesses, investments in early and growth stage companies, and complementing funds with insight and experience, we transform great ideas into world class companies. 7wire works with business incubators, seed and early-stage investors, and growth equity firms to create the best opportunity for inspired visions to reach the market.

Our portfolio companies include Digedu, Argo Tea, SoCore Energy, Ignite Glass Studios, Education Funding Partners and Pawngo.

name: Grid Connect
html_description: Grid Connect specializes in networking technology and helps businesses big and small create custom and off the shelf solutions for solving problems. In addition to distributing and manufacturing hardware we also have a full staff of engineers who work with our customers to meet their networking and technology needs.

name: Refresh Chicago
html_description:
Refresh Chicago is a community of designers and developers working to refresh the creative, technical, and professional culture of New Media endeavors in and around the Chicagoland area. Promoting design, technology, usability, and standards.

Do you feel like the web needs a new look? Interested in the latest web technologies? Care about design, but feel it must be usable? Want to meet informally with other designers and developers around town?

Currently we meet every fourth Wednesday of the month. If you are in the Chicago area and are interested in attending and/or organizing community meetings, join this group so we can keep you updated.

name: VentureLab
html_description: VentureLab brings together the essential elements to help entrepreneurs succeed. Our experience is in forming, capitalizing and building early-stage companies. We divide our services into four elemental categories: Strategy, Capital, Team and Customers. We help our clients turn their vision into an actionable plan; access the capital they need; build out their management team, advisory board and BOD, and form strategic alliances.

name: Center for Neighborhood Technology
html_description: Founded in 1978, the Center for Neighborhood Technology is a leader in promoting more livable and sustainable urban communities. In fact, our work focused on sustainable development before the term became as popular as it is today. As a creative think-and-do-tank, we research, invent, and test urban strategies that use resources more efficiently and more equitably.

name: Meyer Capel
html_description: 31 attorneys. 17 practice areas. A remarkable range of legal talent and services. Knowledge learned through extensive study, experience and practice, carefully honed to your needs. Seek counsel from Meyer Capel. Our history speaks volumes. Meyer Capel, PC is a full service law firm with a focus on new business start ups. We provide corporate formation assistance and IP ownership and licensing advice.

name: CEO Roundtable
html_description:
The CEO Roundtable is chaired by Brian Jurczyk, CEO of Starfire, and provides a small group interaction for CEO's of technology businesses in Champaign-Urbana to address business operations and best practices.

The event is typically attended by 25-30 executives from local tech companies per dinner. We begin with a networking cocktail reception, following by dinner, introductions of each of the participants, the featured speaker's presentation, followed by discussion among the group. This group by invitation only. If you would like to join the group, please contact Laura Frerichs at lfrerich@illinois.edu.

name: Designer-in-Residence
html_description: The Office of the Vice President for Research at University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign has engaged Dr. Deana McDonagh, Chair of the Industrial Design Program in the School of Art + Design at the University of Illinois and Beckman Institute, as a new Designer-in-Residence. In this role, she will be assisting University of Illinois inventors and entrepreneurs to incorporate product design in their technology development to help improve user experiences and performance of products to meet customer needs. Her research concentrates on emotional user-product relationships and how empathy can bring the designer closer to usersäó» authentic need, and she has completed consumer product design for industrial clients in her extensive experience with new product development. If you are interested in working with Deana to help your new product or user experience, please complete a request for assistance atæhttp://go.illinois.edu/designerinresidence.

name: Sustainable Business Center Incubator
html_description:
The Sustainable Business Center (SBC), located in Galesburg, IL, is a business incubator designed to accelerate the successful development of green, innovative companies through an array of business support resources and services offered both in the incubator and through its network of contacts.

For entrepreneurs who embrace sustainable business practices, the SBC serves as a place for the development of new sustainable businesses. We provide innovators with support services and resources to assist them with this launch. We offer not only mentoring and education, but give them a place for collaboration and the exchange of ideas.

The Sustainable Business Center has been created to capture the following synergies in one place:
Renewable Energies
Energy efficiencies
Conservation
Local food

We encourage and embrace the practices and principles built around a triple bottom line business model. Also known as the three "P's," this philosophy means that people, planet and profit are all equally important to a successful business.

name: Starter School
html_description:
Starter School is the grad school for people who want to learn how to build software and start companies. In a small class of highly motivated people, you will:

  1. Build the functional prototype of your web application by learning Ruby on Rails.
  2. Make your app intuitive and beautiful with Web Design, HTML, CSS and Javascript.
  3. Apply product development and business skills to ship your app and start a company.

More than 600 people from around the world have learned how to code and design software in our three-month programs at The Starter League. With Starter School, we've combined our design and programming courses with product development and entrepreneurship to form a carefully sequenced, fully immersive curriculum for just 52 people over nine months.

name: New Venture and Small Enterprise Lab
address: Polsky Center for Entrepreneurship at The U of C Booth School of Business
resource_name: New Venture and Small Enterprise Lab
html_description: The New Venture and Enterprise Lab Class at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business places teams of 4-6 students with early-stage startup companies to help them move forward on a critical project. Students are highly motivated to learn about life at a start-up company by working on a live project. The New Venture and Enterprise Lab Class is an excellent way to tap the talent and expertise of Booth students through a structured, 10-week class during which you will receive a delivered project and they will earn academic credit towards their MBA.
institution_name: University of Chicago Booth School of Business

name: The Junto Institute
html_description:
Most startup support doesn’t move the needle. So we’re building something that does, inspired by what Benjamin Franklin did nearly 300 years ago, when he brought together a group of entrepreneurial friends and called it the Junto (hoon’ toe). A group of friends who met every week for mutual improvement, philosophical debate, and community improvement. A group of friends who became catalysts, responsible for creating things that moved the needle. Things that have become today’s public university, volunteer firehouse, community hospital, and public library.

There is no “next step” for many startups. So we’re building something for startups that graduate from accelerator programs, university entrepreneurship programs, and founder development programs. Call it a “post-celerator”, call it graduate school for startups, call it finishing school for entrepreneurs...call it what you want. We’re building something that will prevent startups from falling into the valley of death. Something for those founders who are left to fend for themselves just because they may have actually accomplished what so many other startups may not have: initial customers, initial funding, a proven business model, or maybe even all three.

name: Environmental Leverage Inc.
html_description:
With all the concerns today about environmental liability, some of the key issues that manufacturers face include: Globalization, Impact of new Science and Engineering technology, Information systems and e-Commerce, Supply chain management, Changes in production processes and manufacturing, Sustainability, Significant impact on Energy savings and Environmental performance. At Environmental Leverage all of these issues are important concerns.

Delivering you innovative and technical expertise and sound business solutions to help you improve your bottom line is our goal. We offer environmental wastewater training, consulting, lab services, bioaugmentation products, and soil and water remediation.

name: cuDBug
html_description: cuDBug was formed in February of 2012 to provide a forum for those in the Champaign-Urbana region interested in the practice of database management. The group facilitates both professional networking and provides opportunities to hear from speakers on database management system topics of interest. cuDBug aims to meet every other month in the University of Illinois Research Park or nearby.

name: Center for Product Development
html_description:
What if your car broke down on a deserted road and you didn’t have the right tool to fix it?Now, imagine you’re on the space station in orbit around the Earth and need a certain tool for a task? Wouldn’t it be great to just replicate the custom part or tool you need?

It’s not science fiction. It’s rapid prototyping, and it’s available today at the Center for Product Development at EIGERlab. With this process, a working prototype of your product is printed in three dimensions, using a variety of materials, like plastic, rubber or metal.

EIGERlab's Center for Product Development (C4PD) serves the region with leading edge business and engineering support services. Manufacturing, art, engineering, urban design...you name it, and we can assist. The C4PD helps you achieve global level innovation by turning your ideas to products...overnight.

name: Startup Institute Chicago
html_description:
Startup Institute Chicago works with professionals, career changers, and dynamic individuals to equip them with the skills needed to have an immediate impact on the startup company they join. Our primary objective is to align passion with profession, and usher students into a life they love.

Our program is a full-time, immersive, two month experience that will catapult you into Chicago's technology ecosystem in the areas of web development, product and design, technical marketing, or sales and business development.

We’re here to help solve the undeniable challenge Chicago startups are facing in recruiting, training, and retaining young talent. Our experience and position within TechStars and the larger startup ecosystem has shown us that many early hires are ill-prepared for the unique, fast-paced nature of startup working environments. We believe our program will help remove the hiring burden for top-performing growth companies in Chicago that need highly-qualified talent to contribute to their product delivery from the moment they join the team.

name: Champaign Organization of Developers and Engineers (C.O.D.E.)
resource_name: Champaign Organization of Developers and Engineers (C.O.D.E.)
html_description: The purpose of this group is to encourage the growth of the technical community in Champaign Country, Illinois, by offering an exchange for technical professionals and opportunities in the area.
institution_name: Champaign Organization of Developers and Engineers (C.O.D.E.)

name: AVIA
html_description: AVIA is an accelerator dedicated to helping healthcare providers successfully implement emerging technology-enabled products and services. Our mission is to advance the innovation agenda of healthcare providers while saving them time, resources, and capital. We serve as an extender to our members’ executive teams, helping them to identify, evaluate, select, and implement the best emerging solutions that align with their innovation priorities.

name: Illinois Technology Foundation
html_description: We are a grassroots organization with over 300 passionate volunteers that are focused on developing and retaining the best IT talent and leadership in Illinois by bringing real-world career opportunities to the classroom. In doing this, we enrich the careers of students by helping them find meaningful employment that allows them to pursue their technical aspirations and make valuable contributions to their employers.

name: Ensemble
html_description:
Ensemble offers entrepreneurs a one-stop, All-Star powered "digital services suite" to plan, execute and benchmark their efforts from ideation through success. All at 20-40% savings. By Entrepreneurs! For Entrepreneurs! 

The “Digital Services Suite”  is designed to materially increase an entrepreneur’s stand-alone odds of success, as we have “been there and done that” with scores of client case studies detailing current best practices in the industry to use as your blueprint. We truly feel this is a better way to serve our clients, with a completely different one-stop expert approach than what is available in the market today. It gives us a smart way to take equity in startups, by leveraging the collective wisdom and expertise of the alliance members, putting our money where our mouths are, and fostering an environment for rapid growth. We are hopeful our clients will be twice as successful than typical companies with this model, giving startups a higher ROI on their investment and creating more jobs.

name: Breakthrough Results
html_description:
Combining deep skills in executive coaching and management consulting with significant experience in entrepreneurship, Tom Caprel is a leading business advisor. Clients say Tom “makes a bottom line difference”, is “invaluable to our decision making” and acts as “the guide who clarifies our vision and priorities”. Tom works with business leaders and entrepreneurs to help them strengthen their leadership skills and realize positive, lasting behavioral changes that result in transformative personal and organizational results.

Known for being creative, driven and passionate in his pursuit of helping businesses and the people that run them reach their full potential, Tom is a catalyst for change and development for small to medium sized enterprises. He has guided hundreds of SMB owners and their leadership teams as they break through their most complex problems to reach the next level of success for themselves and their businesses. For over 30 years, Tom has demonstrated his ability to fast-track companies, ramp up business development and make operations more effective.

Tom was a successful entrepreneur for more than 20 years, starting and growing several businesses prior to founding BreakThough Results, Inc. As an innovative entrepreneur, he developed a passion for the leading trends in organizational and leadership development which led him to step out of his last technology business and create a powerful executive coaching and strategy practice that has served clients for the past 13 years. Cultivating individual and corporate transformations using his Breakthrough Moments methodology, Tom has never lost his passion for teaching business leaders how to break through their toughest most change resistant issues as well as take advantage of their most outstanding opportunities, ones they never thought they could create and handle.

name: The Founding Moms
html_description: The Founding Moms is a collective of offline meetups and online resources where mom entrepreneurs can exchange, connect and learn from one another. Incredible women living right in your backyard meet up to swap start-up stories, interact with renowned business experts, and build personal and professional connections within the ever-growing network of mom-owned businesses.

name: West Suburban Angels
html_description:
In 2011, there were over 16 million dollars in angel funding raised in the Chicago area, an increase of over 50% from 2010 according to the BuiltInChicago Startup Report. There is no doubt that the increase in dollars invested at the angel level has contributed to the continued growth of the startup scene in the Chicago area. The numbers continued to grow in 2012 when nearly $400 million was raised between angels and venture capital*. As Mayor Rahm Emanuel has said, “Chicago has developed into a city that every investor must watch”.

Yet the founders and advisors of the West Suburban Angels saw an opportunity when angel groups and start-ups focused only on the city of Chicago, and the North Burbs. With no formal angel groups in the western suburbs, the team recognized the opening to contribute and accelerate growth in the start-up community for the entire Chicago metropolitan area!

After a great deal of networking, research and support from both start-up and community advocates, West Suburban Angels are pleased to announce their launch and planning their first angel presentation forum to investors this fall. Startups from the Midwest will have the opportunity to raise funding and receive mentoring from an elite group of investors.

name: WindyCitySDR
html_description:
I'm interested in bringing "Advanced Manufacturing" back to Chicago, Illinois and start manufacturing a Software Defined Radio device I've been demonstrating around Chicago since October 2012. This single device is the equal of a majority of the products Motorola Mobility, Motorola Solutions, and Google's recently filed Special Temporary Authority with the FCC. This 1 device can be utilized be many different Governmental / Public / Private entities throughout society.

My name is Martin O'Shield who started a company called WindyCitySDR interested in manufacturing Wideband Software Defined MIMO Radio Devices within the Chicagoland.

This upcoming October 15 - 17, 2013 before the Illinois Institute of Technology I'll be presenting / demonstrating Software Defined Radio before their Annual Real Time Communications Conference:

IIT Real-Time Communication, WebRTC, Mobility, VoIP, NG911 ...
http://www.rtc-conference.com/presentation/?hid=107

I'm part of a 2nd group of nationwide participants in Verizon's Powerful Answers & Awards Innovation Program where I yesterday submitted a full proposal to incorporate WindyCitySDR devices within their infrastructure:

http://newscenter.verizon.com/corporate/news-articles/2013/01-08-powerful-answers-award/ äó_

I've demonstrated / presented before the following Chicago Tech Events:

Chicago Public Safety Technology Summit 2012
November 15, 2012 | Hyatt Regency Chicago
http://www.emergencymgmt.com/events/Chicago-Public-Safety-Technology-Summit-2012.html

Bronzeville Visitor Information Center (Three Times)
http://www.bviconline.info/

Chicago Chapter of the Association of Computing Machinery
www.meetup.com/chicagoacm/members/13433244/

MIT Enterprise Forum of Chicago April 2013 @ Citibank Center
www.MITEFChicago.org

UNWIRED | Chicago Venture Magazine Article posted on WindyCitySDR.com:

Apr 20, 2013 -"Martin, he show us new revolution. But audience not understand it, so I translate in good English: http://chicagoventuremagazine.com/2013/04/20/unwired/

The Chicago Android & Google Technology Users Group (3 times):

October 20, 2012
March 20, 2013
June 16, 2013
Chicago-gtug.com/ & http://www.Meetup.com/Chicago-Google/

Techweek Chicago LAUNCH 2013 @ the Merchandise Mart
LAUNCH é Techweek¬ Chicago - June 27-29, 2013
techweek.com/chicago/events/techweek-launch/

As well have demonstrated this Device before 1871 @ The Merchandise Mart for a 5th time before:

AT&T Mobile App Hackathon - Chicago
http://www.eventbrite.com/event/6876918047

And since WindyCitySDR was selected by the World Future Society 2013, I've demonstrated before their event too:

Futurists: BetaLaunch, the World Future Societyäó»s third annual innovation competition, will allow WorldFuture 2013 attendees to get a glimpse of the companies, start-ups, and inventions that are changing the future. Here are the creators weäó»re honoring at F:BL this year. (Proof can be provided upon request)
http://www.wfs.org/futurist/2013-issues-futurist/july-august-2013-vol-47-no-4/10-future-changing-inventions-ready-launc

My goal is to manufacture Wideband SDR MIMO devices within Chicago to stoke Economic Development, Infrastructure, and employment.


Sincerely,



Martin O'Shield
Martin@WindyCitySDR.com
www.Meetup.com/Software-Radio

name: Mountain Stream Group, Inc.
html_description:
Mountain Stream Group is a multi-discipline communications consultancy. We engineer our clients’ success by blending visual, verbal, nonverbal and sensory communication into a multidimensional, behavior-affecting message stream that creates a physical, rational and emotional connection between our clients' stakeholders and their brand, products or services; causes action; and results in problems being answered — on an individual application or a holistic organizational basis.

We’re able to provide consumer, business-to-business, industrial, and professional services organizations a singular place to obtain a cohesive, consistent brand message for all their brand touchpoints by combining engineering, management consulting, marketing communications and workforce development services.

We ensure our clients' success is sustainable, repeatable and scalable in an ever-evolving ecosystem by making it a performance standard, and programming our Nexus Control Loop — 6-step closed-loop design process — for their application.

name: Jump Trading Simulation & Education Center
html_description:
Jump Trading Simulation & Education Center (Jump) is a virtual care delivery setting that replicates all areas of patient and family care. Actual medical equipment is combined with state-of-the-art simulation devices to provide the highest level of medical research, training, and innovation and to attract the finest minds in clinical education.

As remarkable as the Jump facility is , more significant is what it does. Jump programs and objectives are central in improving the safety, effectiveness, and efficiency of care for community members across the region. Jump serves as an incubator where collaboration, innovation, and improvement leads the transformation of health care worldwide.

The core elements of Jump are simple: professional education for preparing clinicians, clinical service training for a wide range of caregivers, and health care systems and engineering research and development. Outcomes at Jump will be measured through the yield of superior clinicians, performance improvement in health care delivery, and new devices and processes that advance clinical training.

name: Biopharmix Consulting
html_description:
BIOPHARMIX assists biopharmaceutical companies augment their marketing, sales and commercialization worldwide. We support the sales and marketing teams of CROs, small pharma and biotech firms by increasing and improving their capacity. Large companies appreciate our ability to bring and implement current and new ideas strategies. With the goal of improved human health, a proven record in genomic research, and professional background in pre-clinical trial projects, we hope to support your - or your clients' - pharmaceutical and biotechnology efforts.


SPECIALIZATIONS:

•Prospecting & Pre-qualification
•Engaging Qualification Communication
•Campaign Design & Execution
•Sales Representation in the Field & at Industry Meetings
•Reports - Sale summaries, Territory analyses & Industry reports
•Salesforce/CRM Selection, Migration, Maintenance & Integration
•Business Development

name: Fresh Startups
html_description:
Freshii and Kinetic Cafe have joined forces to help serious entrepreneurs launch the world's next wave of breakthrough health and wellness startups.

Fresh Startups is a new kind of program that combines the channel power and demand generation of a leading global enterprise with the disruptive creative thinking of an innovation firm and the proven startup acumen of successful entrepreneurs to offer you an unmatched opportunity to build and scale a breakthrough business...not just create a deck for investors.

We replace the theory of building your business with a rare opportunity to capture an instant audience and test your product/service in the real world with real customer and real revenue generating potential. From planning to execution our team is in it with you every step of the way.

name: The Designation
html_description:
We're a group of passionate designers who have come together to build a purely design-focused school called The Designation. There's a beautiful revolution happening in technology where design is more important than ever. Designer-founders are generating billions of dollars in growth for their businesses. From Apple, Airbnb, and Instagram, to Path, Pinterest, and Twitter, the best companies in the world are the most design-driven ones. The future of innovation is a focus on the user experience. Come join us and we'll make you a designer.

Our program is a 10-week course in the city of Chicago, where we will teach you all the fundamentals of digital design. From research to coding, and from wireframing to native mobile design, we've overloaded the curriculum with the goal of making you a full-stack designer by the end of the course.

name: 813 Launchpad
html_description:
Your creativity and innovation soars when you are around like minded entrepreneurs. We created the West Loop Launch Pad to give fellow entrepreneurs a place to:

  • work productively
  • be part of a community
  • have access to additional support
  • be able to learn what you need to run your business even better

The West Loop Launch Pad is a co-working site designed to help you launch your new business or grow the one you have. Our fellow entrepreneurs in the Launch Pad are typically creative, innovative professionals. They are launching or incubating an entrepreneurial enterprise. They are passionate and focused on their business – and looking for a way to be around others.
