name: Inspire Business Center
html_description:
INSPIRE Business Center is a brand new full-service executive suite facility. The finest in services and technology, without the high cost and inconvenience of a high-rise office tower. In addition to being Chicago's first and only self-contained, new construction facility, Inspire is also the only downtown business center which offers: 

  • On-site Parking: Parking for you and visitor parking plan for your guests
  • High Energy Suites: Equipped with their own private bathrooms and showers
  • The Real Green: Built in accordance with LEED Silver specifications (final certification pending)
  • Flexible HVAC Hours: Heating & air conditioning after hours & weekends

name: Onward Coworking
html_description:
Onward Coworking is a cozy, casual coworking space located in the West Loop. We provide flexible month-to-month desk and office rentals in a unique, industrial timber loft space professionally designed to accommodate a number of different working styles and preferences.

Our space revolves around three simple elements: dynamic people, inspiring workspace, and outstanding location. But Onward is more than a cool place to work, it’s an evolution of work itself. It’s a fresh new perspective on how we can influence the environment that surrounds your work to improve your happiness at work. It’s a push onward, forward, and ahead to change our working world for the better.

name: Serra Ventures
html_description: Serra Ventures, LLC is a professional advisory firm offering a comprehensive suite of services to the middle market, with a special emphasis on early stage and emerging high technology companies.  Serra Ventures’ principals bring decades of business experience spanning multiple disciplines and industries to each consulting engagement.  We work carefully with your team to understand your organization’s unique needs in order to design and implement a customized approach to meeting them.

name: Envision Sales & Marketing, Inc.
html_description:
Our all-encompassing service offering enables our clients to work with one effective partner for all of their sales, marketing and business development needs. We work within your budget and develop and individualized plan based on your business' specific needs and goals. Our goal is to become a true partner and successfully help you grow your business.

Envision Sales & Marketing provides a one-stop atmosphere for multiple cumulative marketing and sales functions, melding critical tools and functions together to assist businesses with their growth initiatives. We have listed our primary service offerings below; however, if you need assistance with an area not described, please contact us today to discuss how we may be able to assist you with your business marketing needs.

MARKETING SERVICES

  • Market research (qualitative & quantitative)
  • Marketing strategy and plan development
  • Brand strategy / branding
  • Market & competitive positioning
  • Marketing collateral development
  • Website planning and development
  • Media & ad planning (on-line and off-line)
  • Promotions and loyalty programs
  • Social media planning & execution
  • Sponsorship & endorsement marketing
  • Trade show marketing
  • Public relations strategy & campaigns
  • Media relationships, editorial campaigns
  • Marketing results analysis


DESIGN & CREATIVE

  • Logo design & development
  • Tagline creation
  • Corporate identity standards
  • Collateral review, design & development
  • Package and merchandising design
  • Web & e-communications design
  • Ad design
  • Direct mail - postcards, mailers
  • Business forms design
  • Copywriting and presentations


VALUE ADDED BUSINESS SERVICES

  • Strategic business planning & development
  • Expansion & growth planning
  • Product development
  • Line extensions /sourcing
  • Order tracking, EDI & vendor compliance
  • Customer service support
  • Budget development
  • Comprehensive IT Services


SALES FUNCTIONS

  • Sales consulting
  • Customer Management & growth development
  • Pricing structure / customer sales program development
  • Sales force development & management
  • Sales compensation systems
  • Alternate channel sales development


BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT

  • Business development strategy and process
  • Strategic partnerships & alliances, negotiation and management

name: Mission Main Street Grants
html_description: Chase is committed to helping small businesses like yours so you can take big steps for your business and your community. Chase is proud to announce Google as the Premier Sponsor of Mission Main Streetäæ Grants. Together, we’re bringing you special benefits that can help you grow your business. Through Mission Main Streetäæ Grants, businesses can apply for a $250,000 grant from Chase. Business also gain access to our Social Media Toolkit in addition to receiving a Google advertising offer to help your business.

name: Product Development Technologies (PDT)
html_description: PDT is a global, full-service product development firm with 130 employees in eight offices worldwide. Team members have expertise in a wide range of product development disciplines, including strategy, scouting, design research, industrial design, user experience development, mechanical and electrical engineering, software development, and sourcing. PDT’s award winning product designs have been recognized with more than 60 awards from authorities such as BusinessWeek, Fast Company, the Industrial Designers Society of America and The Consumer Electronics Association.

name: Seyfarth Shaw LLP
html_description:
Seyfarth’s Technology Transactions Team has significant experience in technology transactions and the technology industry.

Our cross-disciplinary team of 20 attorneys have represented some of the world’s largest companies, as well as innovative growth and start-up companies in creating, enhancing, licensing, selling and acquiring intellectual property and technology assets.

Our focus is not just on getting the deal done, but helping clients gain a true competitive advantage. We work with clients to identify and exploit their technologies, and draft, negotiate and structure agreements that derive the full value of intellectual property and technology assets.

We advise companies across industries on issues ranging from day-to-day technology contract matters to the complex multinational sourcing and joint venture arrangements. Our core areas of strength include:

Licensing and technology transfer
Outsourcing of technology services
Angel/Venture Capital/Private Equity financing
Strategic alliances and joint ventures
Mergers and acquisitions
Technology development contracts
Intellectual property advice
Social Networking
Internet and cloud computing
Privacy and data security
Distributor and reseller matters

As part of representing clients in technology related transactions, Seyfarth also has developed broad relationships with organizations that provide capital to emerging, innovative start-up technology companies. Our firm proudly sponsors Cornerstone Angels, The Entrepreneurship Institute, and the Association for Corporate Growth in key markets.

Outsourcing Our lawyers have handled some of the most complex and strategic multinational sourcing transactions ever undertaken, with total contract value in the billions of dollars. We work closely with our clients to create lasting, effective, value-driven relationships between technology suppliers and service providers, and their customers.

Several large, multinational clients have engaged Seyfarth Shaw in connection with high-volume contract review, because of our innovative approach to the unbundling of services to manage, streamline and reduce the cost of such review. The processes we have developed help companies increase efficiencies, leading to more consistent quality and cost effective transaction processing.

name: Aipil
html_description: Under Construction

name: OMS TEST LISTING
html_description: IGNORE

name: OMS TEST LISTING 2
html_description: Test

name: The Starter League
html_description: The Starter League is an in-person school focused on helping beginners learn how to solve problems through technology. We teach 3-month courses teaching web development, HTML & CSS, javascript, visual design, and user experience. Our new Starter School program teaches beginners how to build web applications and start companies in 9 months. We also teach web development and design in Chicago through our partnerships with the Mayor's Office, Chicago Public Schools, City Colleges of Chicago, Latin School of Chicago, as well as University of Chicago and Northwestern University.

name: Jump Capital
html_description:
Jump Capital is an investment firm specializing in venture and growth capital investments in early stage and lower-middle market companies.

Led by experienced operating executives, we are value creators who take an opportunistic, long-term approach to venture and private equity investing. Entrepreneurs can expect the advocacy and support of an angel investor, complemented with institutional-level resources.

With a focus on investments ranging from $2mm to $15mm, we seek opportunities in asset-light companies within the technology, marketing, healthcare, financial services, and business support industries.

name: Illinois Applied Research Institute
html_description:
The Illinois Applied Research Institute is the state's leader in performing translational R&D for commercial and government mission-driven organizations. Launched in late 2013, it is a joint initiative of the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign College of Engineering and the Office of the Vice Chancellor of Research that harnesses the considerable depth of creativity and scientific ability on the Illinois campus.

The ARI provides the University of Illinois with a formalized conduit for collaborating on open, proprietary, or classified projects. With over 25 employees, the ARI is rapidly expanding its ranks to perform specialized research in areas such as advanced materials and manufacturing, communications and cybersecurity, biotech, and Big Data. A flexible business model that allows for the hiring of expert researchers quickly to meet unique project demands and close deadlines is a core element of the ARI.

Current and recent commercial partners include John Deere, the Boeing Company, and Leidos. Government agency partners include Sandia National Laboratories and Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory.

The ARI is based in the University of Illinois Research Park, Champaign-Urbana's technology and scientific business center.

name: Free Range Office
html_description:
Work when you want, how you want. Whether you are a startup, freelancer, blogger, entrepreneur, consultant, at-home or remote worker, Free Range Office (FREO) provides a place for you to be your most productive and your most liberated. You set the pace, and the terms, in an environment that promotes comfort, innovation, networking and collaboration.

FREO offers an alternative to the corporate box and the isolating home office. Our welcoming ambience provides extra amenities to make your life easier, including ergonomic chairs and spacious desks; private telephone room; outdoor terrace; chef's kitchen; gourmet coffee and tea; video blogging studio; laundry and dry cleaning delivery service; and even a weekly chair massage day to work out those knots.

So workers of the world, reunite. Let’s come together in ways that enhance creativity, peace of mind and work-life balance. Free Range Office is where you can untether, pull up a chair next to like-minded individuals and exhale. Be part of the coworking movement and join us now. Free Range Office: Work outside the box.

name: Erickson Law Group, PC
html_description:
The Erickson Law Group, PC provides legal services to protect our client’s intellectual property. Each of our attorneys is a Patent Attorney admitted to practice before the United States Patent and Trademark Office. We serve clients ranging in size from large companies to startup companies to individual inventors.

Our intellectual property services include:

  • Patents
  • Trademarks and Unfair Competition
  • Cybersquatting & internet domain name disputes
  • Copyrights
  • Trade Secrets 
  • IP Litigation
  • Licensing

name: Northshore Process Service Network
html_description:
Northshore provides innovative global business solutions äóî professional, reliable and accessible äóî encompassing the following comprehensive service domains.


Private Investigation Services
We can provide your company with information on potential investors and buyers, conduct due diligence, pre-employment screening and provide other critical information.

Process Services
Northshore manages all process serving needs including: serving on individuals, private or public entities; preparation of related Affidavits of Service; confirmation of service; courthouse issuing and filing at all levels of court; and, when necessary, skip tracing. We have trusted process servers globally.

Document Filing/Retrieval and Litigation Search
Northshore offers a full range of due diligence services, including corporate and personal document retrieval and litigation research capabilities.

Authentication and Legalization
Northshore provides full service in the area of authentication and legalization of domestic and foreign papers, working with various Departments of Foreign Affairs and International Trade and the foreign embassies/consulates worldwide.

Court/Clerking Services & Due Diligence Searches
Our operatives can provide you with thorough and professional searches in any court jurisdiction. Additionally, we provide vital record searches, property record searches and bankruptcy searches as well as any county, state and federal searches.


Northshore Process Service Network
1560 Sherman Avenue, Suite 301
Evanston, Illinois 60201-4803
T: 1.847.373.8972
F: 1.866.554.2485
Email: info_nps@lawyer.com
Web: http://northshoreprocess.wix.com/northshore

name: Metro East Start-Up Challenge
html_description:
The SIUE Metro East Start-Up Challenge is a business plan competition to recognize and reward excellence in entrepreneurship. University Park at SIUE is the competition sponsor. The St. Louis Regional Chamber and PNC Bank are award sponsors. The SIUE School of Business and Metro East Small Business Development Center (SBDC) facilitate the event.

University Park partners with SBDC to conduct a $15,000 cash prize business plan competition for entrepreneurs and new business start-ups in the Illinois portion of the St. Louis metropolitan area. The purpose of the challenge is to:

  • Increase the region’s interest in and excitement for business start-ups through a competitive process
  • Identify “high impact” start-ups for possible location in University Park’s new Business Enterprise Center
  • Generate a greater awareness of SBDC services/resources for entrepreneurs and small business owners in the Metro East region
  • Advance the academic mission of the University by strengthening relationships with private enterprise and expanding learning opportunities for both students and faculty

The first place winner recieves a $10,000 cash prize accompanied by in-kind professional services. Low cost office accommodations in University Park may be available to the winner depending upon suitability and the availability of space. The second place plan receives a $5,000 cash prize along with in-kind professional services.

name: BLUE1647
html_description: BLUE1647 is an entrepreneurship and technology innovation center focused on education (through classes and workshops), workforce development (through internships), business acceleration (through Hybernate), and economic development in technology and 21st century skills. BLUE1647 supports all forms of entrepreneurship from events, filmmakers, artists, engineers, and designers. As a beacon of resource through physical space and curated programming, BLUE1647 provides impactful individuals and organizations the space, curated programming, and resources to realize their ideas for a better world. Listed in the first City of Chicago Technology Plan, the BLUE1647 community is a vibrant example of the ways in which creative professionals, entrepreneurs, change-makers, and nonprofits can come together to make meaningful, lasting impact.

name: Chicago Startup Weekend
html_description:
Startup Weekends are weekend-long, hands-on experiences where entrepreneurs and aspiring entrepreneurs can find out if startup ideas are viable. On average, half of Startup Weekend’s attendees have technical or design backgrounds, the other half have business backgrounds.

Beginning with open mic pitches on Friday, attendees bring their best ideas and inspire others to join their team. Over Saturday and Sunday teams focus on customer development, validating their ideas, practicing LEAN Startup Methodologies and building a minimal viable product. On Sunday evening teams demo their prototypes and receive valuable feedback from a panel of experts.

name: Sigenics Inc.
html_description: Sigenics designs and manufactures custom electronic integrated circuits ("IC chips"). We can take you from concept to the delivery of tested packaged parts. We're an ISO9001 company, and have biomedical impants in human clinical trials, and mil std 883 aerospace devices in commercial and military aircraft.

name: Innovations 4 Entrepreneurs
html_description:
Technology can be transformative. Leveraging the cloud…enabling workers to be mobile…collaborating like never before…Comcast Business sees so many incredible stories about how smart, innovative use of technology helps create exciting, profitable businesses. With the Innovations 4 Entrepreneurs Contest we are recognizing the entrepreneurs that are making both customer and employee experiences better with technology. Winners will receive a combination of cash, services from Comcast Business as well Comcast’s UpwareTM partners Cisco, Microsoft, Symantec, DocuSign, Soonr and Swiftpage Engage and invaluable one-on-one consulting with business experts.

Entry submission for the 2014 contest is due by April 30.

name: Freeborn & Peters LLP
html_description:
Andrew L. Goldstein focuses his practice in the area of Intellectual Property and Information Technology. He has extensive experience in the areas of intellectual property law, including trademark, trade dress and copyright law; internet, website, cloud computing, technology, outsourcing and computer law in general; advertising, marketing, and promotion law; and entertainment law, including video production, theater and dance-related matters.

The Chambers-USA Guide to America’s Leading Lawyers, calls Andy a “business law expert,” and adds that "He is smart and versatile, with broad expertise and an extremely fast turnaround time."

name: Health, Technology, and Innovation
html_description:
The Health, Technology, and Innovation (HTI) facility, encompassing 12,000 square feet of laboratory and office space within the Illinois Medical District, brings scientists, clinicians, engineers and industry together for an interdisciplinary approach to drug, diagnostic, device, and information technology development. HTI provides both a physical space and support services that validate technology, convert innovation into products, and accelerate projects to venture readiness.

HTI intends to provide the infrastructure where technology development work can take place outside of academic labs with support and access to professional services to assist in commercialization planning and venture formation guidance. With a community-based approach, HTI serves University faculty, staff and students, Chicago area research institutions as well as the broader entrepreneurial community as a nexus of biotechnology commercialization.

name: CivicLab
html_description:
CivicLab is a new co-working space in the West Loop at 114 N. Aberdeen Street dedicated collaboration, education and innovation for civic engagement.  Our call to service is – Investigate. Educate. Activate.

At the CivicLab you can:

  1. Co-Work. Rent a permanent desk for $200/month. Be part of a community of dynamic people and organizations who all want to see a better world and are working to make it happen!
  2. Learn. Take a class and gain some civic skill and knowledge. It’s like a Democracy Gym here! Build your civic muscles at the CivicLab.
  3. Teach. Share your civic skills, experience and knowledge by offering a general admission workshop at the CivicLab. We split all class fees 50-50 with our instructors.
  4. Meet. Use our space for meetings, events, retreats and celebrations. You won’t find a more reasonable hourly rate or a more friendly crew anywhere!

name: Clean Energy Challenge
html_description:
The Clean Energy Challenge is the Midwest’s leading showcase for clean energy innovation. The annual event combines a business plan competition for Midwestern entrepreneurs, researchers and students with presentations by leading clean energy thinkers and doers.

A High-Impact Event

A full day event in Chicago, the Clean Energy Challenge brings together leaders, entrepreneurs, investors, industry experts and media. The Clean Energy Challenge is the flagship event and fundraiser for Clean Energy Trust. It is open to the public, though tickets are required.

Since the event launched in 2010, Clean Energy Challenge competitors have:

  • Been awarded over $750,000 in prize money
  • Raised $40 million in follow-on funding
  • Benefitted from Clean Energy Trust’s network of over 200 mentors and 160 industry partners
  • Twice won DOE’s National Clean Energy Business Plan Competition, won Rice University’s Business Plan Competition and taken top honors at Clean Tech Open.

name: Unified Equity
html_description:
Unified Equity serves extraordinary entrepreneurs, who are building promising B2B companies, by rapidly accelerating their sales cycle into Fortune 500 companies.

The biggest challenge B2B entrepreneurs face? Finding their first customers. Not anymore.

Our goal is to make the life of B2B startup founders dramatically simpler and more effective.

If you’re starting a B2B company, we know one of your biggest growing pains is identifying and closing your first handful of customers. It shouldn’t be.

We focus on directly connecting you to decision makers inside the Fortune 500. We help you find the decision makers at companies you want to work with, as well as successful mentors and advisors to help you every step of the way as you grow your startup, so you can focus on building the best company and product.

name: Wellspring Worldwide
html_description:
Wellspring products enable you to innovate faster, access knowledge quickly, and optimize your investments in research and innovation.

Companies use our software to identify, evaluate, and share knowledge assets developed by and among their network of collaborators: from Tech Scouting to IP Management to Open Innovation initiatives.

Universities and hospitals turn to Wellspring software to manage their Technology Transfer, Grants Management, and Clinical Trials Administration more effectively and efficiently.

In sum, our software enables innovators to harness their knowledge assets for competitive advantage.

name: Product Manufactory
html_description:
We were founded on the principle of never separating design from engineering, always keeping in mind the user and the manufacturing process. We are a team of designers, engineers and creatives that bring the R&D department into businesses that do not have one, or are seeking a new perspective on current initiatives. We pride ourselves on our ability to identify, define, and execute development projects that help you differentiate and win in your market.

WHAT WE DO

We offer electrical and mechanical engineering expertise, industrial design and prototyping services to create new, game-changing products for you and your customers. Our work is carefully planned, executed, and documented so that you always have complete visibility and control of status, budget, and direction.

name: STEMfunder
html_description:
STEMfunder is a social crowdfunding platform for academic projects and research in Science Technology Engineering Mathematics (STEM). STEMfunder works with alumni networks to provide great ideas with funding and exposure.

Using STEMfunder, students can reach out to potential supporters directly. Supporters can fund projects that resonate with them, and actively engage with teams through new projects and updates.

We believe that academic projects are a key component in the advancement of STEM education. Projects encourage innovative thinking and student engagement, while promoting STEM programs within the academic community.

name: Ms.Tech
html_description:
Introduction
Ms.Tech is a learning community that provides women in the ventures of innovation and technology with the inspiration, knowledge, and connections to reach their full potential. Ms.Tech encourages women to develop entrepreneurial management thinking, educated risk taking, creative problem solving, and inspirational, supportive leadership for their teams/organizations/ businesses. Ms.Tech is a community and forum, for early, mid-career, executive, and entrepreneurial women in technology careers. Ms.Tech members are committed to developing themselves as leaders through education, mentorship, networking, and information sharing.

Community
Our diverse membership represents industries ranging from entrepreneurship, information technology, and to cleantech. Ms.Tech members work in these industries as well as in organizations that support and collaborate with these industries such as professional service firms, financial institutions, and non-profit groups. Ms.Tech offers a rich and thriving community that provides support, guidance, and professional development. Members can leverage a broad array of workshops and panels that include advice regarding career advancement, alternate careers options, professional skill building and exposure to entrepreneurial thinking. Through education, mentorship, and engaged networking, we strive to serve our diverse community so our members can achieve their full potential.

Membership
Membership is an excellent opportunity for members to expand their network, further their professional development and advance their career. Members find support in Ms.Techäó»s unique community network of peer and mentor role models. Ms.Tech membership offers a chance for people to meet colleagues and form friendships that enrich professional and personal life.

Member benefits include:
Exclusive rates to all Ms.Tech programs and events
Free attendance at our annual networking events
Access to Ms.Techäó»s Members Only webpages with workshop summaries
Voucher to bring a non-member guest for free per year
An individual membership for one year is $35 per month or $365 a year.
Workshops and Panel Discussions
Ms.Tech panel discussions and workshops cover issues that are relevant to the career and business issues in the life sciences, biotech, engineering, technology and research. Ms.Tech events feature accomplished and prominent speakers, who share their expertise and experiences in a setting that encourages access to these speakers, networking and shared learning with Ms.Tech members. Ms.Tech organizes long-term accountability programs and weekly mastermind sessions focused on womenäó»s career advancement and entrepreneurship growth with Subject Matter Expert facilitators. Ms.Tech offers many interesting events per year.

name: Grind
html_description: Grind is a 22nd century platform that helps talent collaborate in a new way: outside the system. Grind isn’t an office, it’s the antidote to offices. A members-only shared workspace and coworking community dedicated to taking all of the frustrations of working the old way and pulverizing them to a dust so fine it actually oils the wheels of the machine. A space that caters to free radicals like you.

name: Quinlan Social Enterprise Competition
html_description: For the past eight years, Loyola University Chicago’s Quinlan School of Business has hosted a Business Plan Competition, but beginning in 2013, the focus has been on the developing area of social enterprises. Quinlan has made social enterprises a key strategic initiative, and thus the Quinlan SEC is an opportunity for individuals who are interested in developing and launching social enterprises around the world to present their business plans to a panel of judges, who will evaluate the business plans and provide feedback regarding the business plan’s viability.

name: Digital Professional Institute
html_description:
The Digital Professional Institute trains starters, working professionals, agencies, and companies on the most relevant digital skills of the 21st century. Through targeted programs taught by world-class practitioners, our learners have access to the entire digital ecosystem — digital marketing, social media, video production and post-production.

The Digital Professional Institute works with its instructors to ensure that their real-world, on-the-job learning content and case studies are backed by the academic rigor of higher education, so that you can leave class ready to make an impact on your organization.

name: Rev3 Innovation Center
html_description: Rev3 is an innovation center located in DuPage County, Illinois, with a focus on helping people and companies manufacture products, write software and develop technology to drive the third industrial revolution. From astonishing waves of innovation to new product concepts to technology that changes business models - Rev3 is a place of emerging opportunities and creativity. This is not a place for business as usual.

name: IAEOU
html_description: The Institute for Arts Entrepreneurship (IAEOU) is a Chicago based science, technology, arts and math (STEAM) entrepreneurship and innovation oriented incubator. We incubate STEAM entrepreneurs and design interdisciplinary curriculum for entreprenuership through Institute for Arts Entrepreneurship (IAE). Through our sister organization, Entrepreneur The Arts, we deliver our courses online in our own live learning classroom environment launching in August of 2014. The IAEOU is focused on teaching a creative entrepreneurial mindset for life long endurance and success, and on supporting innovation for new venture and authentic job creation.

name: IAEOU
html_description:
What We Do
IAEOU.me " Vowels are to words what creativity is to the world- basic and necessary." is a Chicago based STEAM entrepreneurship and innovation oriented incubator. We incubate STEAM entrepreneurs and design interdisciplinary curriculum for entreprenuership through Institute for Arts Entrepreneurship (IAE).

Through our sister organization, Entrepreneur The Arts, we deliver our courses online in our own live learning classroom environment launching in August of 2014.

What We Believe
If you look at the Kauffman Foundation Index, despite the explosive growth of entrepreneurship programs, over the last 17 years entrepreneurship growth is flat. We believe this is because Creativity- which has been in decline for the last 30 years, based on the Torrence Test of Creativity, is sorely missing in entrepreneurial development.

What We Do
We are focused on teaching creative entrepreneurial mindset for life long endurance and success to support innovation for new venture and job creation authentically. Our methodology design is 'inside out' transformation- aligning the personal to professional. We accomplish this through a 256 hour 8 course curriculum for high school students, college students and lifelong learners. Our program is accredited through the Univ of CA San Diego. To learn more about it click here: http://iaeou.me/iae-curriculum/

Publications:
Our model will be featured in The Design Journal, 17:3, in Sept of 2014. Some of our research from our pilot program, completed in June of 2013 in collaboration with faculty from The School of Design, University of Illinois, also be published this fall by USASBE in a book called 'The Annals of Entrepreneurship Pedagogy' by Elgar in the UK.

Additional publications about our methodology include:

Developing the Arts Entrepreneur: The “Learning Cloud”. Crafting the Future, 10th European Academy of Design Conference. Apr 2013, Gothenburg, Sweden April 5, 2013

Deepening the Social Impact of Creativity Through Entrepreneurialism, Proceedings of the United States Association for Small Business and Entrepreneurship (USASBE) Conference, January 13-15, 2012: 1007-1017

name: NewFrontier Holdings
html_description: Formed by Nate Laurell in July 2010, NewFrontier Holdings is a Chicago-based holding company that manages various forms of investments; creates and funds innovative ventures; and facilities an engaging community of entrepreneurs. NewFrontier manages a small seed-stage venture fund that takes a hands-on approach, often starting companies itself. Through NewFrontier Capital, we manage traditional assets like public equities, private debt, and real estate. We also own solar and other renewable assets. Our investing philosophy focuses on margin of safety and intrinsic value. NewFrontier Holdings is also intent on building a community of entrepreneurs and has designed 35,000 square feet of coworking space in Chicago’s West Loop.

name: Chicago Innovation Exchange
html_description: The Chicago Innovation Exchange (CIE) is the University of Chicago’s new hub for multidisciplinary collaborations. We support business start-up activities and entrepreneurs converting research and ideas into solutions benefitting society. The CIE will bring together the University’s distinctive strengths in research and resources from a network of world-class entrepreneurship programs to drive innovation in a range of areas, applying scientific discoveries to generate scalable solutions to difficult societal problems.

name: The Nest
html_description:
The Nest is a coworking space in Peoria's historic Warehouse District. It is a shared work environment that combines the flexibility that independent professionals have with the connectedness they need. The goal of The Nest is to lower the barrier of entry to business by providing shared office amenities, as well as foster an environment of collaboration among individuals and organizations.

The Nest is also home to Project | Rocket Science, a 21st Century Learning Lab dedicated to design, development, and entrepreneurial thinking. With small classes focusing on creativity, technology, and collaboration, the space hopes to inspire and grow the impact of startup and innovation activities within Greater Peoria.

name: Boone Management Group
html_description: Founded in 2010, clients work with Boone Management Group Inc for the in-sourced approach that helps them tackle their most pressing change management challenges. Boone Management Group Inc. is committed to providing our clients with the standard of excellence in business strategy advising through business growth and people management solutions. Clients work with the combined expertise in business strategy, human capital management and talent search and acquisition giving a holistic solution to your business needs.

name: The Warehouse
html_description: Founded in 2013 by Lightbank, The Warehouse is a coworking space for the tech community in Chicago. Located at 600 W, a tech hub in Chicago, this new membership driven space surrounds thinkers and innovators with other venture-backed entrepreneurs.

name: Project | Rocket Science
html_description: Project | Rocket Science builds immersive learning in creativity, technology and collaboration to grow the skills of designers, developers, entrepreneurs, intrapreneurs and innovators in Central Illinois.

name: Startup Peoria
html_description: Startup Peoria exists to develop, encourage and promote the entrepreneurial startup community in the Central Illinois region. Our vision is to provide entrepreneurs and intrapreneurs with the tools, resources and ecosystem to ideate, collaborate and launch successful businesses that contribute to the long-term growth and prosperity of the local economy.

name: Roundtable Healthcare Partners
html_description: RoundTable Healthcare Partners was founded in 2001 and is based in Lake Forest, Illinois. We have a unique combination of operating and transaction professionals who have worked together for more than 20 years, and have over 200 years of collective healthcare experience in medical products, devices, pharmaceuticals, and distribution.

name: Shore Capital Partners
html_description: Shore Capital Partners ("Shore") is a healthcare-focused lower middle market private equity firm that specializes in partnering with companies that have between $5 and $50 million of revenue.  Shore is focused on making control equity investments within the healthcare services, products and distribution markets.  Utilizing a proactive, research-led investment process, our approach is to support entrepreneurs with capital, business development expertise, and industry knowledge.  Shore targets investments in proven, successful private companies with superior management teams, stable cash flow, and significant growth potential, including organic and growth through industry consolidation.

name: Delaney Law, PC
html_description: Delaney Law is a client driven business litigation firm that provides top notch legal counsel for companies and individuals. Our practice areas include Corporate Law, International Business, Real Estate, Hospitality, Tax & Bankruptcy as well as State and Federal Litigation (Civil and Criminal).

name: A1 Active Care
html_description: Home Healthcare Services, Backup Childcare, Caregiver and Certified Home Health Aides. (Licensed, Bonded & Insured).

name: High Street Capital
html_description: We are business builders. We are dedicated to, and passionate about, finding differentiated companies and fundamentally improving them. We back this strategy with our own personal capital. Our approach starts with seeking opportunities to improve selected businesses within the lower middle market. It includes a willingness and ability to offer flexible and creative solutions to business owners looking for liquidity.

name: NextSpace River North
html_description: NextSpace River North is located in the heart of Chicago’s downtown gallery district. We are situated just beneath the “Chicago” CTA stop, and half a block from the #66 bus route. Our members come from a variety of industries: software, design, marketing, legal, architecture, and engineering, just to name a few. Some of them are lifelong freelancers, while others have been downsized from bigger companies and are just beginning to venture out on their own. We think they’re pretty cool, and we love spending our days with them!

name: Catalyze Chicago
html_description: Catalyze Chicago is a non-profit coworking space dedicated to Chicago's hardware focused entrepreneurs. This West Loop studio hosts a community of designers, engineers, hackers, makers, movers and shakers. The first of its kind in the city, we provide not only shared office and workspace, but also access to tools and the broad expertise of a uniquely talented community. As a not-for-profit entity and users of our own space, we are committed to 100% reinvestment to provide our members the best possible resources we can. We are also avid supporters of the arts and sciences, dedicated to sharing the wonders of design and engineering with local students, colleges and museum communities.

name: Code for Rockford
html_description:
Code for Rockford is a brigade program in Rockford Illinois that helps local volunteer groups partner with government in an effort to enhance their communities. Brigades hold regular hack nights, events, advocate for open data, and deploy apps. Currently, in 31 cities and four countries, Brigade volunteers and local government officials are creating new avenues for civic engagement and working to create an open and participatory city hall.

There is also an established Code for Rockford meetup.com group @ http://www.meetup.com/Code-for-Rockford

name: The Law Offices of Marc J. Lane, P.C.
resource_name: The Law Offices of Marc J. Lane, P.C.
html_description:
The Law Offices of Marc J. Lane provides general corporate organization and management planning from the initial selection of the business structure through the entire incorporation process, including negotiation and development of the capital structure, financing placement, shareholder agreements and securities law compliance. On a continuing basis, we work with our clients to maximize their business structure's utility and legal compliance through the initiation, negotiation and drafting of employment agreements, stock purchase agreements, leases, fringe benefit programs, and mergers and acquisitions. As general counsel, The Law Offices of Marc J. Lane provides continuing initiative in all areas of legal decision-making.

The Law Offices of Marc J. Lane also provides individuals, families and businesses with innovative and effective tax and estate planning strategies. We counsel clients on virtually every aspect of tax and estate planning, to help minimize worry and risk. Our attorneys work closely with clients to evaluate their unique situations and help them achieve their goals. We put in place all necessary documents to maximize tax efficiency and minimize the risk of disputes.

As our clients are both national and international, we regularly serve foreign enterprises doing business, or seeking to do business, in the United States. We consider ourselves uniquely qualified to assist international and trans-national enterprises in structuring strategic alliances, licensing and distribution arrangements, U.S.-based subsidiaries and branches, and both "in-bound" and "out-bound" commercial transactions.
institution_name: The Law Offices of Marc J. Lane, P.C.

name: Geek Breakfast
html_description: EIGERlab announces a new networking event for the IT community: Geek Breakfast.  Geek Breakfast began in Nashville, TN. The Rockford Geek Breakfast is a monthly community-driven meeting for local (and visiting) technology-minded people. Each month attendees congregate, order some breakfast in a social environment and discuss topics like social media, digital marketing, design, programming, apps, open data and ways to better our community.

name: Coalition: Energy
html_description: Coalition: Energy is a coworking hub of professionals in energy. Leveraging more than a decade of coworking experience, Coalition seeks to provide a venue for collaboration and productivity for small businesses. Located in the heart of Chicago, Coalition: Energy occupies the penthouse suite of the historic Gage Building on Michigan Avenue. Just steps away from trains and downtown shops, members at this space enjoy panoramic views, which includes Millennium Park and Lake Michigan

name: Kaskaskia College Institute for Entrepreneurial Success Business Incubator
resource_name: Kaskaskia College Institute for Entrepreneurial Success Business Incubator
html_description: The Institute for Entrepreneurial Success Business Incubator will serve tenant needs by offering assistance for early stage firms and the creation of new start-up businesses. The Incubator will help nurture entrepreneurial and economic development in the community by providing affordable office space, services, training, mentoring, and a network of professional advisors.

name: MATTER
html_description:
MATTER is a community of healthcare entrepreneurs and industry leaders working together in a shared space to individually and collectively fuel the future of healthcare innovation. Matter is a supportive space that illuminates the path to success through mentorship, networking and shared resources. We provide a sense of community among members and extend out to the greater healthcare network, both locally and globally. Located in Chicago’s historic Merchandise Mart, MATTER’s downtown location offers immediate access to a wealth of cutting-edge technology and premier medical institutions.

MATTER is now accepting applications >

name: Law Office of Lesley A. Wallerstein, LLC
resource_name: Law Office of Lesley A. Wallerstein, LLC
html_description:
When you’re ready to grow your idea into something bigger, you need a law firm that understands the business of invention. More than just getting you a patent, trademark or copyright, Lesley Wallerstein is your startup’s idea counsel.

Educated at MIT and trained at the U.S. Patent & Trademark Office, I have the technical and legal skills to get the job done right.

Flat fees for most services mean no hidden costs and no counting minutes on the clock when you need advice.

Free referrals to trusted business support professionals in marketing, finance, manufacturing and promotion.

If you have a concept you want to take to the next level, contact me.

name: Straight North
html_description:
Straight North is a digital marketing agency with clients throughout the U.S., we have offices in Downers Grove, IL (headquarters), Baltimore, MD, Charlotte, NC, Chicago, IL, San Francisco, CA and Washington DC.

Our approach emphasizes transparency, measurable results, strategic creativity and tactical precision. Straight North services include SEO, PPC, web design/development and branding.

name: Inspire Business Center
html_description:
Introducing the Inspire Business Club, a state-of-the-art facility conceived and built for the sole purpose of providing entrepreneurs and small businesses with the environment, technology and services they need to thrive. And the best part is, our coffee is always free.

We offer a variety of office space including executive suites, virtual offices, meeting rooms and conference rooms, and coworking space. Our building was designed from the ground-up to help working professionals and entrepreneurs succeed. We have free parking for clients, fiber internet, electric car charging station, and outdoor space with WiFi. Inspire Business Center is the space to take your business to the next level.

name: EcoFaire Accelerator
address2: Inside TIC~An Incubator @ The IL. Science & Technology Parkway
html_description:
EcoFaire JOBBANKS {IP Pending} is a concept being presented as a Social Entrepreneurship strategy to inspire a Green Industrial Movement Worldwide. We want to initiate, foster, help rebuild, renovate, remediate, recycle spent resources and rejuvenate Communities throughout the world. Focusing on supplies of labor, trained and untrained, we want to uplift, nurture, and support and expand these communities through our JOBBANK concept.

We have found that there needs to be more innovative and disruptive strategies to support individuals in their quest for meaningful and creative positions, allowing them the opportunity to contribute into their community, state or region which then forms an “EcoFaire system”. This recycling of local “dollars” feeds the JOBBANKS.

The initial phase of forming a Local EcoFaire JOBBANK needs support from local community Colleges and Universities. There is a need to have a National/International Audit created to reach the various levels: Unemployed from 18-35,Underemployed, Veterans, recently Discharged from the Military, Disabled, Those wanting to volunteer and Mentor as well as those reaching 50 and above.

EcoFaire Institute will spearhead this undertaking and will utilize various strategies to reach our goal of finding positions for everyone. This International Institute will educate, inform, set curriculum for Green Technologies, products and services, and incorporate this curriculum into each EcoFaire Region through their respective JOBBANK. Environmental, Mental Health and Everyday living issues will be looked at opened to discussion. Challenging young adults and Entrepreneurs to bring about change and establish a policy for everyone by dealing with the issues and bringing employable solutions.

The EcoFaire International Institute will be championing a concept of Green Civil Defense. It is a call to action for everyone to consider solutions to environmental problems. Some of those include: Climate Change which brings an Invasion of microorganisms and how to best deal with these environmental hazards in an organic way leading to a Zero Carbon Footprint. Worldwide Transportation presents many problems including Public Health and Safety Issues regarding the spread of Flu and other diseases.

Disasters and the mobility of people that follows awaken diseases that have otherwise remained dormant for years. Finding an organic solution to these problems and using it to further a Green Industrial revolution is one main goal of Green Civil Defense. We will be creating a Network of Local Chapters and in coordination with The EcoFaire Institute where we will bring a Video Network to locations and Events throughout the World.

name: celumium - The future of Brand and Product Management
resource_name: celumium - The future of Brand and Product Management
html_description:
#CustomerExperience_Chicago

The future of Brand and Product Management

Engaging customer experience will play a vital role in how brands and products are perceived in the future

When it comes to global trends in marketing and brand management, customer experience is one of the main factors digital age marketing managers will have to face in future endeavors.

celumium, the Marketing Technology Conference, will focus on best practices about customer experience in brand and product management within the venue SIX10 in Chicago. Seasoned speakers will explain the value of customer experience in brand management and you will learn, how global brand companies use state-of-the-art technology to deliver the perfect message of their brands and products to customers around the globe in an omni-channel kind of way: in-store, online, mobile äóñ everywhere.

Keynote by Forrester Research Analyst Anjali Yakkundi

name: Internet of Things Chicago Meet-Up
html_description:
The Internet of Things Chicao meet-up is the premier gathering for those who want to make meaningful connections in the IoT space. The meet-up brings together executives and technical leaders from multi-billion dollar companies to mid-sized firms to early stage busineses. This is the ideal place for business development, sales leads, intelligence and networking.

The IoT meet-up is attended by professionals from leading organizations such as Motorola, Nokia, Microsoft, American Family Insurance, Chamberlain Group, GE Capital, Siemens Medical, Sprint, AT&T, Verizon, US Cellular, Leo Burnett, IBM, Chicago Public Schools and City of Chicago. Professionals from Ann Arbor, Champaign, Madison, Milwaukee, Detroit, etc. are regular attendees – bringing together interest from the greater mid-west.

name: Diversity Agreements, PCS
html_description:
Diversity Agreements, Procurement and Communications Solutions 

We have personal experience with small business enterprise for minorities and women owned entrepreneurs. We provide market research for promotion, advertising, sales forecasting, including a market feasibility study and assessment of a client's customer service performance. We assist in the preparation and planning for the identification of private and public-sector contracting opportunities; in the development of capability statements, teaming and joint venturing relationships. We also assist with estimating services costs, support for bid preparation, providing contacts for bonding, take-offs and business consulting.

name: Operation: Startup
html_description:
Operation: Startup was created to bring new entrepreneurs the comfort and confidence of having an integrated support team that is on board to bring their new business idea to life with efficiency and insight.

Operation: Startup is an all-inclusive startup kit for new and growing businesses. From business models to branding, legal to logos, Operation: Startup will get you and your business launched in as little as 90 days with an expert team of talented startup pros.

name: Beecken Petty O'Keefe & Company
html_description: Beecken Petty O'Keefe & Company ("BPOC") is a Chicago-based private equity management firm founded in 1996 to invest in middle-market buy-out transactions, recapitalizations, and growth platforms in the health care industry. BPOC evaluates, structures, and manages investments on behalf of institutional and individual investors.

name: CME Group/Liquidity Ventures LLC
html_description: As an industry leader, CME Group recognizes the need to foster innovation – both within and outside of our company. With that in mind, Liquidity Ventures I, LLC, a wholly-owned subsidiary of CME Group, Inc., makes minority stake investments in early stage technology companies whose innovative products and services may impact CME Group’s business in the longer term.

name: Corazon Capital
html_description: The fund, which will focus on tech companies, has raised about $6.6 million, according to a securities filing first reported by the blog Strictly VC. The filing doesn't specify how much they plan to raise.

name: Duchossois Capital Management
html_description: Duchossois Capital Management was formed to consolidate and coordinate all current and future investment activities of the Duchossois organization and to complement the family’s operating businesses that are held by The Duchossois Group. DCM has assimilated and will expand upon the activities of Duchossois Capital Partners and Duchossois Technology Partners.

name: Creation Investments Capital Management LLC
html_description: Creation Investments Capital Management, LLC is a leading alternative investment management company with a focus on private equity investments in Microfinance Institutions, Small-and-Medium Enterprise lenders, Emerging Market Banks, and other BOP Financial Services Providers.

name: Edgewater Funds
html_description: The Edgewater Funds is a Chicago-based private equity firm with $1.4 billion in committed capital. Edgewater provides capital and resources to lower middle market companies to help accelerate their growth and market leadership.

name: Flexpoint Ford LLC
html_description: Flexpoint Ford is a private equity investment firm with $1 billion under management specializing in financial services and healthcare. Our Principals are among the most experienced investors in the U.S. in these two large sectors of the economy.

name: Frontenac Company
html_description: Frontenac Company is a Chicago-based private investment firm founded in 1971. We are currently investing from our tenth equity fund. We invest in high-quality, closely-held companies, primarily in services industries. We work with the owners of mid-sized businesses, almost always families or founders, as they address complex transition issues of liquidity, management enhancement, and growth planning. We have been involved with over 200 ownership transitions in closely-held companies.

name: Geneva Glen Capital
html_description: Geneva Glen Capital (“GGC”) is a Chicago-based private equity firm that invests in lower middle-market companies (generally under $100 million in value). We partner with successful management teams to invest in proven private companies with leading market positions, significant growth potential, and stable cash flows.

name: GTCR LLC
html_description: A true visionary in private equity, Stanley Golder founded GTCR in 1980. Believing that private equity is a business about people, GTCR pioneered “The Leaders Strategy” – finding and partnering with management leaders as the critical first step in identifying, acquiring and building market-leading companies. Since 1980, GTCR has invested more than $10 billion in over 200 companies.

name: Harrison Street Real Estate Capital
html_description: Harrison Street Real Estate Capital LLC* ("Harrison Street") strives to be one of the leading real estate investment management firms by offering investment products across both private and public real estate segments. Our firm's goal is to create a series of differentiated investment products across multiple risk/return platforms.

name: Lake Capital Management LLC
html_description: Lake Capital currently manages more than $1.3 billion in equity commitments and seeks to build leading services companies through organic and acquisition-enhanced growth. We typically allocate $50-75 million of equity to each of a number of initiatives to build leading business services enterprises through organic and acquisition-enhanced growth. We are currently investors in and are actively exploring additional opportunities in a variety of business services sectors.

name: LaSalle Capital
html_description: Since 2004, LaSalle Capital has partnered with over 30 companies in the lower middle market to drive growth and create value. We utilize a strategic and collaborative approach that respects the knowledge of those who have built the businesses we acquire and leverages our industry expertise and successful formula for growing and developing small businesses.

name: Linden Capital Partners
html_description: Linden Capital Partners devotes world-class resources to developing exceptional healthcare companies. Dedicated focus and expertise, collaborative partnerships, and a diligent value creation program differentiate our firm. Our companies not only grow, they prosper.

name: Lionbird Ventures
html_description: A new generation of start-ups is plugging online technologies into physical processes and experiences. By harnessing cloud computing and crowd networking, companies are revolutionizing certain offline markets in ways never previously imagined. These technologies open endless opportunities to meaningfully improve healthcare delivery, retail processes and enterprise collaboration. LionBird invests in young companies capable of making it happen.

name: Madison Capital Partners Corp.
html_description: Madison is a Chicago-based holding company led by former CEOs, CFOs and entrepreneurs investing their own money to build market-leading companies that deliver outstanding customer value. We have created an entrepreneurial ‘safe haven’ where leaders can thrive! Madison’s equity capital is permanent with no artificial timelines or investment horizons. We truly build and hold our companies for the long term.

name: Madison Dearborn Partners
html_description: MDP’s objective is to invest in companies in partnership with outstanding management teams to achieve significant long-term appreciation in equity value. A flexible investment approach, encompassing both management buyouts and structured minority investments, has been a key tenet to MDP’s investment philosophy for several decades.

name: Mesirow Financial Private Equity
html_description: Mesirow Financial Private Equity, founded in 1982, provides institutional investors with access to leading private equity managers and co-investment opportunities in the private equity market. Following our investment strategy, Mesirow Financial Private Equity seeks to generate returns for investors that exceed private equity industry benchmarks and are commensurate with asset class risk, through the construction of diversified portfolios of highly-performing private equity investments.

name: Mid Oaks Investments LLC
html_description: Mid Oaks Investments is a private investment firm that invests its own capital in middle market companies that possess a substantial opportunity for value creation. We seek to partner with entrepreneurial management teams with the foresight and vision necessary to elevate an enterprise to the next level of performance.

name: Muller & Monroe Asset Management
html_description: Muller & Monroe Asset Management, LLC "M2" is a private equity firm that was formed in 1999 to exclusively focus on managing private equity funds and separate accounts for institutional investors. M2’s entire franchise is directed to focus on emerging investment management firms that are niche/specialty (new and next generation) managers. Our target investment specifically encompasses 1) serial deal investors; 2) spin-outs; 3) funds backed by wealthy families; 4) regionally-focused funds; 5) industry-focused funds; and 6) other niche funds with an attractive value proposition. Women and minority-owned firms are actively considered.

name: Prairie Capital LP
html_description: We facilitate ownership transitions for companies in the lower middle market. Sounds simple enough. But in the world of the lower middle market, every opportunity taps our deep well of experience in developing flexible approaches that build equity in the investment. We understand the lower middle market because we’ve spent our careers working and investing along side business owners and management teams. The lower middle market is, was, and always will be our only focus.

name: Pritzker Group Private Capital
html_description: Pritzker Group Private Capital acquires North American-based companies with enterprise values between $100 million and $500 million, focusing on quality businesses with leading positions in the manufactured products, services and healthcare sectors.

name: Prospect Partners
html_description: Prospect Partners is a leading lower-middle-market private equity firm based in Chicago. We focus exclusively on management-led leveraged recapitalizations and acquisitions of small companies with niche strategies. We manage three funds totaling $470 million and are backed by a premier group of institutional investors. We are a highly experienced, active, and committed investor in smaller lower-middle-market companies with revenues typically under $75 million. Since 1998, we have invested nationwide in more than 110 companies in a broad range of niche markets, including consumer, commercial, manufacturing, distribution, and specialty business and consumer services.

name: RCP Advisors LLC
html_description: RCP Advisors, LLC, a federally registered investment adviser, is a private equity investment management firm that provides access to lower middle market private equity fund managers through funds-of-funds and through direct co-investments. RCP generally works with buyout fund managers with funds of between $200 million and $1 billion in committed capital. These fund managers then seek to invest in lower middle sized companies - typically, with $10 million to $250 million in enterprise value.

name: Silver Oaks Service Partners LLC
html_description: Silver Oak Services Partners is a lower middle market private equity firm focused exclusively on service businesses. We seek to partner with exceptional management teams to build industry leading business, consumer and healthcare service companies. Silver Oak utilizes a proactive, research-led investment process to identify attractive services sectors and seek out the best potential management teams and investment opportunities. We bring extensive services industry expertise and relationships to our investments and work closely with our management teams to drive long-term value creation.

name: Sterling Partners
html_description: We are a private equity firm with a distinct point of view on how to build great companies. We’ve been here since 1983 and have invested billions of dollars, but that’s not what really defines us. Our purpose is Inspired Growth, which describes not only what we do, but how we do it. It reflects an unrelenting commitment to people and partnerships, to ideas and ideals that drive success.

name: Svoboda Capital Partners
html_description: Svoboda Capital Partners is a Chicago-based private equity firm that invests in leading middle market growth companies. We focus on companies in the value-added distribution, business services, and consumer products and services sectors typically valued between $20 million to $100 million. We seek to partner with and empower outstanding management teams with a track record of success and a desire to execute on well-defined growth initiatives. Founded in 1998, we have more than 50 years of collective private equity experience, extensive industry contacts and a culture of honesty, integrity and hard work.

name: Synetro Group LLC
html_description: We are a Chicago-based private investment and strategic advisory firm. Founded in 2000, Synetro has invested in and grown multiple successful business to business internet/softtware and business services companies as well as a niche consumer capital goods manufacturer. Synetro partners with strong management teams to fund and build high-performing companies. Drawing on the experience of Synetro’s principals and advisory network of seasoned corporate executives and entrepreneurs, Synetro is uniquely positioned to support early stage and mature businesses drive profitable growth and maximize their potential.

name: Thoma Bravo
html_description: Thoma Bravo represents one of the longest and most successful histories of private equity investing. Our “consolidation” investment strategy and process was developed more than 30 years ago and more recently has been refined through a series of private equity investment funds representing more than $7.5 billion in committed capital. Thoma Bravo targets control investments in companies with strong business franchises led by experienced executives who aspire to achieve industry leadership. We work in close partnership with a company’s management team to implement operating best practices and use our consolidation expertise to rapidly improve earnings and increase equity value. Thoma Bravo has invested in many fragmented, consolidating industry sectors and has particular expertise in application software, infrastructure software and technology enabled services sectors.

name: Victory Park Capital
html_description: Victory Park Capital is a privately held registered investment advisor dedicated to alternative investing through the management of private investment funds. As specialists in credit and private equity investments, VPC focuses on middle market companies across a diversified range of industries. Whether as a lender or a control investor, VPC seeks to identify opportunities where it believes the potential for reward outweighs the risks entailed. Founded in 2007, VPC is headquartered in Chicago with additional resources in Boston, London, Los Angeles, New York and San Francisco.

name: Water Street Healthcare Partners
html_description: We are strategic investors who specialize in growing, middle-market healthcare companies. Water Street focuses exclusively on growing market leaders in four segments of healthcare: medical and diagnostic products, specialty distribution, outsourced healthcare services, and specialty pharmaceutical products and services. We have nearly $2 billion to invest in our companies.

name: Waud Capital Partners
html_description: Founded in 1993, Waud Capital Partners is a leading middle-market private equity firm that partners with exceptional management teams to create, acquire, and/or grow companies that address significant, inefficient, highly fragmented and underserved industry segments. We invest primarily through control-oriented growth equity investments, industry consolidations, buyouts or recapitalizations and seek companies that generate strong cash flow and can be grown both organically and through add-on acquisitions.

name: Waveland Investments
html_description:
Waveland Investments is a Chicago-based private equity firm with a committed fund that focuses on lower middle market manufacturing, distribution and service companies all over the United States.  Waveland is actively seeking opportunities with the following characteristics:

  • Companies with revenues greater than $10 million or existing EBITDA between $1 million and $5 million.
  • Companies with strong market position or franchise value.
  • Companies with strong management teams requiring capital to obtain the next performance level.
  • Bankruptcy Code Section 363 sales, Assignments for the benefit of Creditors or other turnaround opportunities requiring intense oversight and/or new management.

name: Wind Point Partners
html_description: Wind Point Partners is a private equity investment firm that partners with top caliber executives to acquire middle market businesses where we can establish a path to value creation. Since our founding in 1984, we have raised over $2.8 billion in commitments and acquired more than 90 platform companies and 160 add-on acquisitions. We are currently investing from a $915 million fund closed in April 2009.

name: Wynnchurch Capital
html_description: Founded in 1999, Wynnchurch Capital is a leading value-oriented, operationally-focused private equity firm that invests in middle-market companies in the United States and Canada. Specializing in complex transactions, we leverage a business’s strengths, identify new market opportunities and provide strategic support to realize management’s vision—with an unwavering commitment to sound business judgment, partnership, communication and integrity.

name: Small Business Loans
html_description: ezDinero Loan Solutions provides credit-building, affordable loans to individuals and small business owners. We are a free referral service that primarily serves to empower individuals who have limited or no credit history.
